Class Entity

java.lang.Object
com.gr15.pacman.model.entities.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ghost, Pacman
public abstract class Entity extends Object
Represents an abstract entity with a position and collision radius on a game board.

This class stores both tile-based Position and fine-grained sub-tile coordinates to allow smooth movement within and across grid tiles.

The full world coordinates are computed by combining the integer Position with subTileX and subTileY, allowing sub-tile precision.

Handles movement logic including direction changes, wall collisions, snapping to tile centers, and updating position on the game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(Position startPos, double radius, double speed)
      Constructs an Entity with the specified starting position and radius.
      Parameters:
      startPos - The initial tile-based position of the entity.
      radius - The collision radius of the entity.
      speed - The speed of which the entity moves, in tiles per second.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is invalid: - startPos is null - radius is less than or equal to zero - speed is less than zero

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(GameState.TileType[][] board, double deltaSeconds)
      Updates Pacman's Position based on the time elapsed and the game GameState.TileType state. Handles turning, and tile boundary transitions. Handles moving through multiple tiles by stepping.
      Parameters:
      board - the game GameState.TileType, used to determine valid movement.
      deltaSeconds - time in seconds since the last update in seconds.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if board is null

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()
      Gets the tile-based Position of the entity.
      Returns:
      The current tile position.

    • getRadius

      public double getRadius()
      Gets the radius of the entity.
      Returns:
      The collision radius.

      Gets the full X coordinate, including sub-tile offset.
      Returns:
      The entity's X position as a double.

      public void setPosition(Position newPos)

      newPos - The new tile position to set (not null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if newPos is null

      Parameters:
      newX - The new sub-tile X coordinate.
